title: Set main site footer background to burgundy/terracotta red

requirements.text: Update the main site footer background color to a burgundy/terracotta red using the existing design-token approach (CSS variables + Tailwind theme colors), and ensure footer text/link contrast remains readable in both light and dark mode.

quotes: please use the color burgundy/terracotta red for the footer background

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx` no longer uses `bg-card` for the outer `<footer>` background; it uses a dedicated footer background utility (e.g., `bg-footer`).
A new footer color token is defined in `frontend/src/index.css` (e.g., `--footer` and, if needed, `--footer-foreground`) for both `:root` and `.dark`.

`frontend/tailwind.config.js` is extended to expose the footer token as a Tailwind color (e.g., `footer.DEFAULT` and optional `footer.foreground`) so `bg-footer` (and optionally `text-footer-foreground`) work.
All footer content (headings, paragraph text, links, bottom-bar text) remains clearly legible against the new burgundy/terracotta background in both light and dark mode.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only components).
Do not modify any paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` from SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not change the header color or other site section colors.
Do not change footer layout, spacing, links, or logo assets beyond what is required for color/contrast.
